intro: Tapeinosperma punctatum, commonly known as the African star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asparagaceae and is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves and showy, star-shaped flowers. The plant produces small, red berries that contain the seeds, which are dispersed by animals. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
